trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of beetroot juice and sodium bicarbonate supplementation on 4 km cycling time trial time to completion in well-trained male cyclists
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of beetroot juice and sodium bicarbonate supplementation on 4 km cycling time trial time to completion in well-trained male cyclists

conditions.healthcondition: Cycling performance in healthy trained athletes

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Conditions of unknown or disputed aetiology (such as chronic fatigue syndrome/myalgic encephalomyelitis)

interventions.interventions:
There are 3 interventions for this research project that aims to examine the isolated and combined effects of the treatments:
Arm 1: Sodium bicarbonate + placebo beetroot juice. 0.3 g/kg body mass sodium bicarbonate consumed in capsule form orally with water, 80 g (20 g per day) of nitrate-free beetroot powder consumed orally with water for 4 days.
Arm 2: Placebo sodium bicarbonate + beetroot juice. 0.3 g/kg body mass maltodextrin consumed in capsule form orally with water, 80 g (20 g per day) of beetroot juice crystals consumed orally for 4 days with water.
Arm 3: Sodium bicarbonate + beetroot juice. 0.3 g/kg body mass sodium bicarbonate consumed in capsule form orally with water, 80 g (20 g per day) of beetroot juice crystals consumed orally for 4 days with water.
Sodium bicarbonate is administered 2.5 hours prior to the commencement of each 4 km time trial.
Beetroot juice crystals/placebo is administered once nightly in the 3 days prior to a 4 km trial and again 1 hour prior to the commencement of each 4 km time trial.
The wash-out period is 3 days between each arm of the study.
interventions.comparator: Placebo sodium bicarbonate + placebo beetroot juice. 0.3 g/kg body mass maltodextrin consumed in capsule form orally with water, 80 g (20 g per day) of nitrate-free beetroot powder consumed orally with water for 4 days.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Time to completion of each 4 km cycling time trial (performance)

secondaryOutcome.timepoint:
Baseline, 1 h, and immediately pre 4 km time trial
Immediately after and 75 min post 4 km time trial

Baseline, 1 h, and immediately pre 4 km time trial
Immediately after and 75 min post 4 km time trial

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: VO2 max > 65 ml.kg.min, > 2 years competitive cycling experience
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: VO2 max < 65 ml.kg.min, any physical contraindications to high intensity exercise

othercollaborator.othercollaboratoraddress: Leverrier Street, Bruce, 2617, Australian Capital Territory

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
The primary purpose is to determine if there is an additive effect of beetroot juice and sodium bicarbonate on 4 km cycling time trial performance.
Sodium bicarbonate and beetroot juice act via different mechanisms once ingested and therefore we hypothesise that combined supplementation will improve 4 km time trial performance (time to completion) more than beetroot juice or sodium bicarbonate alone or placebo.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Presentation at Sports Dietitians Australia, Melbourne October 2015: Callahan, M.C., Parr, E.B., Burke, L.M., Hawley, J.A., (2015). Effect of beetroot juice and sodium bicarbonate supplementation on 4 km cycling time trial time to completion in well-trained male cyclists.
